bibl.title: The Disclosure Formula in the Epistolary Papyri and in the New Testament: Development, Form, Function, and Syntax.
bibl.note: Argue that a proper understanding of the disclosure formula has significant implications for our understanding of theme, letter structure, transitions, and prepositional modification in New Testament letters. The four elements that make up the formal and semantic criteria for the formula in Hellenistic letters are: (1) lexical content; (2) morphology and literary form; (3) information content; and (4) dialogic communication.
